title: Sanctuary of Pan at Paneas
description: The Paneion at Caesarea Philippi, a sanctuary site dedicated to Pan centered around a natural cave and spring site on the southwestern slopess of Mount Hermon. The sanctuary was first built in the Hellenistic period (before 200 BCE). A temple to Augustus was constructed in front of the cave during the reign of Herod the Great in 19 BCE, and the site was further expanded through 220 CE.

properties.description: Polygon representing the boundaries of the sanctuary site at Paneas, derived from an OpenStreetMap Way after Friedland 2012
properties.title: OSM location of Sanctuary of Pan
